comment.author: 38755969@N04
comment._content: This was part of the 1909 Naval Pageant (July 17th to 24th) when about 150 ships of the Royal Navy were on display on the Thames from the Houses of Parliament to the Nore inc Temple Pier and Tower Bridge. This was to show Londoners the new Navy they were being asked to pay for in their taxes. Other countries were racing to improve their Navies with Dreadnoughts and submarines. The King inspected the Home and Atlantic Fleets off Southend on the Nore.
